title._content: [Church in Sterzh near the village of Novinka. St. Vladimir's (Peter and Paul) church] (LOC)

description._content: To Make Your Own Color Photo from the Original Glass Plate Negative, use this file: www.loc.gov/pictures/resource/prok.01093/ Prokudin-Gorskiĭ, Sergeĭ Mikhaĭlovich, 1863-1944, photographer. [Village of Novinka. Vladimirskaia (Peter and Paul) Church in the Sterzh pogost (country churchyard)] [1910] 1 negative (3 frames) : glass, b&w, three-color separation ; 24 x 9 cm. Notes: Title with new identification information provided by Yuri Krasilnikov in 2008, from the Web site Khramy Rossii [Churches of Russia], www.temples.ru/pg_mistakes.php Updated to explain the country churchyard. (Source: Legacy of S. M. Prokudin-Gorsky, 2013) Forms part of: Sergei Mikhailovich Prokudin-Gorskii Collection (Library of Congress). Subjects: Villages. Churches. Wooden buildings. Fences. Russia (Federation)--Novinka. Russia (Federation)--Volga River Region. Format: Glass negatives. Color separation negatives. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. For additional information on commercial use, see "Prokudin-Gorskii...," lcweb.loc.gov/rr/print/res/237_prok.html Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/prokc.21093 Call Number: LC-P87- 6008
